items.name: Jalakandeswarar Temple – Worship And Walk
items.section_excerpt: Built-in the Vijayanagara style of architecture, the Jalakandeswarar Temple is dedicated to Lord Jalakandeswarar, an avatar of Lord Shiva. The temple includes two courtyards, the main shrine, and a couple of sub-shrine. Glorious sculptures, adorned pillars, and engraving on the ceilings are the primary attraction of the temple. Some of the major festivals that are celebrated here are – Chaitra Poo…
items.description: Built-in the Vijayanagara style of architecture, the Jalakandeswarar Temple is dedicated to Lord Jalakandeswarar, an avatar of Lord Shiva. The temple includes two courtyards, the main shrine, and a couple of sub-shrine. Glorious sculptures, adorned pillars, and engraving on the ceilings are the primary attraction of the temple. Some of the major festivals that are celebrated here are – Chaitra Poornima, Mahashivaratri, Aadipooram, Vinayaka Chaturthi, Navarathri attending which is one of the fun things to try in the city.
query_hints: Jalakandeswarar Temple – Worship And Walk

items.name: Delhi Gate – Explore The History Of Tamil Nadu
items.section_title: Delhi Gate – Explore The History Of Tamil Nadu
items.section_excerpt: Located on the banks of River Palar, the Delhi Gate was once a part of the Arcot Fort and played a part at the famous Siege of Arcot which makes checking out this place one of the great things to do in Vellore. The place is full of ruins and it holds historic importance as the British defeated the French at the Siege of Arcot. If you're an Anglo-Indian history buff, come here to relive the British…
items.description: Located on the banks of River Palar, the Delhi Gate was once a part of the Arcot Fort and played a part at the famous Siege of Arcot which makes checking out this place one of the great things to do in Vellore. The place is full of ruins and it holds historic importance as the British defeated the French at the Siege of Arcot. If you're an Anglo-Indian history buff, come here to relive the British history in India.
items.location_hint: Arcot – Kanchipuram Rd, Arcot, Vellore, Tamil Nadu 632503

items.name: St. John’s Church – Seek Blessings
items.section_excerpt: Opened in 1846, St. John's Church is one of the oldest churches in the city. The church follows the English Gothic style of architecture and is well-known for its historic significance, interior decoration, and the wonderful idol of Jesus on the cross making visiting the place one of the most popular places to visit in the city. British soldiers who lost their lives during the Sepoy Mutiny are bur…
items.description: Opened in 1846, St. John's Church is one of the oldest churches in the city. The church follows the English Gothic style of architecture and is well-known for its historic significance, interior decoration, and the wonderful idol of Jesus on the cross making visiting the place one of the most popular places to visit in the city. British soldiers who lost their lives during the Sepoy Mutiny are buried here.
items.location_hint: Vellore Fort, Fort Round Rd, Balaji Nagar, Tamil Nadu 632004

items.name: Tipu and Hyder Mahal – Explore The Castles
items.section_title: Tipu and Hyder Mahal – Explore The Castles
items.section_excerpt: Tipu Mahal and Hyder Mahal are two castles situated inside the complex of Vellore Fort. Known for its architecture, both the castles have around 180 to 200 rooms. The interior and exterior design on the granite walls will mesmerize you. Due to the high-security reason, the place is currently closed for tourists but make sure you visit this place on your trip to the city as it is one of the top thi…
items.description: Tipu Mahal and Hyder Mahal are two castles situated inside the complex of Vellore Fort. Known for its architecture, both the castles have around 180 to 200 rooms. The interior and exterior design on the granite walls will mesmerize you. Due to the high-security reason, the place is currently closed for tourists but make sure you visit this place on your trip to the city as it is one of the top things to do in Vellore.
query_hints: Tipu and Hyder Mahal – Explore The Castles
Tipu and Hyder Mahal – Explore The Castles Balaji Nagar, Vellore, Tamil Nadu 632004

items.name: Palamathi Hills – Sightseeing
items.section_excerpt: Tucked away from the hustle-bustle of the city, Palamathi Hills is one of the coolest places in the city for sightseeing. With wonderful scenic beauty and breathtaking sceneries, Palamathi Hills is a perfect place for relaxation, photography, bird-watching, picnicking, and some adventure treks which are some of the great things to try in Vellore.
items.description: Tucked away from the hustle-bustle of the city, Palamathi Hills is one of the coolest places in the city for sightseeing. items.name: Periyar Park – For Bird-Watching
items.section_excerpt: Located on the Fort Round Road, Periyar Park is a spacious, serene park that is filled with several species of birds. Swans, Ostriches, White Pigeons, Ducks, Parrot, Love Birds, and more. checking out which is one of the exciting things to do in Vellore. Experiencing bird-watching at Periyar Park to bust your stress!

items.name: Punganoor Lake – Take A Boat Ride
items.section_title: Punganoor Lake – Take A Boat Ride
items.section_excerpt: Boating at Punganoor Lake is one of the interesting things to do in Vellore. Nestled amidst the Yelagiri Hills, Punganoor Lake is one of the most popular man made lakes in India. Known for its refreshing atmosphere and the surrounding atmosphere, this lake attracts thousands of tourists every year.

items.name: Nava Sai Baba Temple – Explore The Temple
items.section_title: Nava Sai Baba Temple – Explore The Temple
items.section_excerpt: Located at Kanipakam, the temple is dedicated to Shirdi Sai Baba and visiting the place is and praying is one of the best and most soulful things to do. The temple is famous for featuring nine idols of Shirdi Sai Baba. Spend time with your family and make a wish.
